title: Toasted tomato tart
description: As simple as cheese on toast, but much tastier - and there are no plates to deal with afterwards.
supplementary: Ripe, juicy tomatoes are a staple of the Italian diet. If you can, use medium-sized Romas - they're at their best this month. For that extra sun-ripened taste, leave them on the windowsill for a few days after buying. Serve this tart in fingers or squares.
instructions: Pre-heat the oven to 180˚C / 160˚C fan. Place 3 pastry sheets on a greased baking tray and pierce them all over with a fork. Bake for 10 minutes or until pale gold.
Remove from the oven and thinly spread tomato paste on each sheet. Then scatter torn basil leaves over and cover with the tomato slices.
Add a knob of mozzarella cheese to each tomato slice. Sprinkle with salt and drizzle with olive oil.
Return the pastries to the oven and bake for a further 6-8 minutes.
Remove from the oven, cut each pastry slice into approximately 16 pieces, season with black pepper, and serve warm.
imageDesc: A small square of crispy puff pastry topped with basil, a slice of roasted tomato, and melted mozzarella.
